conclusion: Analyze forces and use static equilibrium principles.
Weight of the object (mg) acts downward from point D.
Tension in the rope (T) acts along the rope from D to E and from D to F.
Normal forces (F1 and F2) act perpendicular to rods OA and OB at points E and F.
Resolve tension for Ring E into components along OA and perpendicular to OA.
Component along OA is T cos(45°), perpendicular is T sin(45°).
Resolve tension for Ring F into components along OB and perpendicular to OB.
Component along OB is T cos(45°), perpendicular is T sin(45°).
Normal force F1 balances perpendicular component of tension: F1 = T sin(45°).
Normal force F2 balances perpendicular component of tension: F2 = T sin(45°).
Tension must balance weight of object: 2T sin(45°) = mg.
Substitute T into equations for F1 and F2: F1 = F2 = mg / 2.
Final answer: F1 = mg/2, F2 = mg/2.
